title: Mediaeater Digest Vol.30, No. 209
content:
Today’s mediaeater digest points to – AI ethics, car data privacy, and industry impacts. LLM copyright honeypot, while Anthropic is accused of data scraping (they are legion). Tools for media bias detection and an opt-out for X  , who opted you in, to scrape your posts for their AI, whatever it’s called.

New Whitehouse AI commitments and Senate calls to investigate car companies’ data practices. Apple emphasizes iPhone privacy in some super creepy surveillance adverts (where were these a decade ago!),  legal documents in the TikTok/ByteDance case reveal ongoing tensions. Meanwhile, the video game industry needs to come to terms re: voice actors’ strike. (go actors!)

Copyright Traps for Large Language Models  (github) 

AI start-up Anthropic accused of ‘egregious’ data scraping (ft)

Media Bias Detector (mediabiasdector)

Opt out of  x /settings/grok_settings (x)  related (ft)

New AI Actions and Receives Additional Major Voluntary Commitment on AI (whitehouse)

Privacy on iPhone | Flock | Apple (ft)

Senators to FTC: Car companies’ data privacy practices must be investigated (sentate.gov)

Klee Privacy is the Key in AI Age  (klee)

appendix: TIKTOK INC. and BYTEDANCE LTD.,  (courtlistener)

Video game actors are on strike. Here’s what that mean (latimes)
author: MDG
